data.title: Microsoft and Adaptive Biotechnologies' Immune System Partnership Takes on Coronavirus
data.text: The companies teamed up in early 2018 to try to map how the immune system responds to various diseases. Next on their agenda: SARS-CoV-2.

data.title: Microsoft and Adaptive Biotechnologies partner to study immune response to COVID-19
data.text: Microsoft and Seattle-based Adaptive Biotechnologies announced Friday they will work together to map the immune response to COVID-19.

data.title: Microsoft and Adaptive Biotechnologies are studying how the human immune system reacts to the coronavirus
data.text: Microsoft, Adaptive Biotechnologies, Illumina and other companies are partnering on a project to map out how the human immune system responds to the virus. Most efforts, they say, are focused on the biology of the virus.

data.title: Microsoft helps CDC build a coronavirus 'self-checker'
data.text: The chat bot is designed to help you make decisions and seek medical care if needed.

data.title: U.S. Retailers Work to Adapt to Coronavirus Closures
data.text: Companies across the retail spectrum shut down stores to help slow the spread of the COVID-19 pandemic.

data.title: Microsoft Stock Will Prevail Despite Slowing PC Sales
data.text:
Microsoft stock is boosted by more than just Windows and Surface PC sales, as Azure and other cloud software still lead its growth.
The post Microsoft Stock Will Prevail Despite Slowing PC Sales appeared first on InvestorPlace.

data.title: Microsoft Stock Is Attractive at Current Levels
data.text:
With the coronavirus shuttering business for a while, MSFT can truly market its cloud services, making a strong contrarian case for Microsoft stock.
The post Microsoft Stock Is Attractive at Current Levels appeared first on InvestorPlace.

data.title: 2 Attractive Dividend Stocks to Buy Amid the Coronavirus Sell-Off
data.text: These two tech stocks could turn out to be smart long-term bets at their current valuation.

data.title: Microsoft Confirms How Coronavirus Will Impact Windows 10 Security Updates
data.text: Microsoft has confirmed some Windows 10 security support changes in the light of the ongoing COVID-19 pandemic.

data.title: Microsoft Teams Adds 12M Customers In A Week As Coronavirus Forces Remote Work Boom
data.text: Microsoft Corporation's (NASDAQ: MSFT) workplace communications platform Teams added 12 million daily active users between March 11 and March 18, the company said, as reported by MarketWatch.
